channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023080826
item.description:
Report E-2023080826

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: IRWIN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 10, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum containing UN3264 was damaged and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent and absorbents to collect the product. The crew then containerized all waste material in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080706
item.description:
Report X-2023080706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking . upon inspection found one 5 gallon plastic bag of pro strip heavy duty stripper punctured and leaking allowing to release 0.5 gallons from bag no partitions or absorbent was found . facility procedures for hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: 5 gallon plastic bag was punctured and leaking allowing .5 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023080678
item.description:
Report X-2023080678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came to QA in a black tote. Package was upside down in tote and was leaking inside of box. DescribePack: Box was saturated. Upon opening it was noted that one of the bottles had a small puncture right below the spout. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was turned upright to stop leakage. Product was then placed into two separate drums.

item.description:
Report X-2023081771

  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NS personnel found tank car TILX190603 leaking small amount of product under movement. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was the result of a misaligned manway gasket. The gasket was replaced and the manway was properly secured..

item.title: Report X-2023080664
item.description:
Report X-2023080664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: PITTSTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered wet package while unloading a trailer on the floor of trailer. QA was notified and it was placed in hazmat lined tote. Trailer was dry inside. DescribePack: 2 gallons in box both of which had loose caps. 1/2 of 1 gallon spilled out saturating outer box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Loose caps - leaking containers in lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080682
item.description:
Report E-2023080682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the tops of two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to loose bung caps. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the bung caps and wiped down the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) 55-gallon poly drums were then shipped onto the consignee. The spent rags used from the clean-up were containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080643
item.description:
Report E-2023080643

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While moving freight on temporary dock storage location, forklift operator struck a drum with the forkblade of their forklift consequently puncturing the drum and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080558
item.description:
Report E-2023080558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC unit was in transit and loaded with resin solution. A clean-out cap on the trailer was not secured properly and allowed approximately 5 gallons of resin solution to be released. The customer send personnel to remediate the spill.

item.title: Report E-2023080508
item.description:
Report E-2023080508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CORAOPOLIS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipper initially had spilled some product on the outside of the trailer. The loading driver had them clean it up but later admitted that it could have been cleaned better. Second leak was spotted coming from the dome lid by the next driver. The driver tightened the dog ear with the security seal on it 2 turns but it was still leaking. We got permission to break the seal and tighten it properly and then had the takwash clean off the exterior before proceeding.

item.title: Report E-2023080343
item.description:
Report E-2023080343

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon jug of hydrochloric asci (un1789) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
